body: Nicer animation flow for dismiss on swipe #135
- Added min_width max_width to default values.xml #131

- Update snackbar position for tablets/desktops #122
- Fix Activity leak #128

name: v2.10.7
body:
- Fixed IllegalStateException in AccessibilityManager #110 
- Smoother visuals when dismissing by replace #108

name: SnackbarManager works on UI thread
body: Fixes #101

name: Layout fix
body: Action button was not centered with changes from v2.10.4

name: Layout fix for tablets
body: Layout fix for tablets. Fixes #99

name: Snackbar Width Fix for Tablets
body: See #97

- Ability to set the desired with of a `Snackbar` in tablets. See #91 
- Fix to update the text shown in a `Snackbar` instance. See #93

name: Bug Fixing
body: Fix for #23

name: Adding ability for Snackbar's to have margins, custom backgrounds, and be positioned at the top of the container
body: Adding ability for Snackbar's to have margins, custom backgrounds, and be positioned at the top of the container. See #84

name: Add swipe to dismiss listener
body: A new `ActionSwipeListener` has been included to indicate when a `Snackbar` has been dismissed by swiping. See #85 for more details

name: Attach to non-Activity's root view
body:
- You can attach a Snackbar to a non-root Activity view. This closes #62 and provides a workaround for #76 and #27. The following methods are now included as part of the `SnackbarManager`:
  `SnackbarManager.show(Snackbar snackbar, ViewGroup parent)` and `SnackbarManager.show(Snackbar snackbar, ViewGroup parent, boolean usePhoneLayout)`
- Navigation bar handling has been improved. Fixing #45. See #80 for more detail and the latest demo for more detail
- An `EventListenerAdapter` is provided to avoid boilerplate code if you only need to override a subset of `EventListener`. See #81

- A Snackbar's action button can only be tapped once by default. If you really need the action button to be tapped multiple times (can't think of an scenario where you would want this) you have to set explicitly set this behavior

``` java
Snackbar.with(context).allowMultipleActionClicks(true);
```
- A method `isActionClicked()` is now provided to let you know if the action button was tapped. This is useful if you want to know during the Snackbar dimissal if it's being dismissed because the action was tapped or just ran out of time. See #73 
- The EventListener has been extended with a couple of calls: `onShowByReplace` and `onDismissByReplace`. This is useful if you need to NOT move a Floating Action Button down and up while the Snackbar is just being replaced, but still wanted to move up and down on regular show/dismiss callbacks. See #79 
- Support for translucent navigation bar. For translucent navigation bars, their height size is added in the Snackbar's bottom padding. The sample app illustrates this
- A bug has been fixed when the configured color for either the background, text, or action text was white. Prior to this version, the color code #ffffffff was always ignored. See #67 and [this SO question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27939154/cant-set-color-to-white-in-snackbar-android)

name: Custom Typefaces
body:
- You can set a custom typeface for a `Snackbar` text and action text. See #71 
- You can now get the current `Snackbar` from the `SnackbarManager`. See #66 
- RecyclerView is marked as a provided dependency. See #71

name: Possible memory leak fix
body: see #64

name: Bug fix on APIs < 16
body: Height offset was always applied to APIs < 16. Offset should never be applied for these cases. See #57

name: 6" Phones not Considered Tablets Anymore
body: See #55

name: Allow dismissing from SnackbarManager
body: See #53

name: Allow Indefinite Duration
body: `SnackbarDuration.INDEFINITE` was added as a `SnackbarDuration` which would keep it on screen indefinitely, needing to be dismissed by swipe or action. See #46

name: Bug fixing + resources refactor
body:
- Added "sb__" prefix to all resources that were missing it
- Fixed NPE when attempting to recycle the velocity tracker used when swiping (#49)

name: SnackbarManager
body: A SnackbarManager is now included with the lib to handle multiple Snackbar messages. See the updated README for usage

name: Add bottom margin if content is fitting system UI
body: Snackbars were not being properly shown with transparent nav bars (KitKat and up). See #41

name: Bug fixes
body:
- Fixed issue where onDismiss() did not get called if Snackbar is swiped #38
- Removed deprecated animation duration getter. Use animation resource getters instead #39

name: Getters for animation resources
body:
Included static getters for animation resources. In that way, clients can apply the same animation or if the exact same animation does not work depending on the use case, they can query the specific fields they need.

The getters are `Snackbar.getInAnimationResource()` and `Snackbar.getOutAnimationResource()`.
The getter `getAnimationDuration()` has now been deprecated. You should query that directly from the resource

name: EventListener extended
body:
- EventListener now has two new events: `onShown()` and `onDismissed()`. This way you have control over the whole animation cycle. Note that now each event will receive the `Snackbar` instance instead of just the height, so you will have to modify your code if updating from a previous version
- Fixed the min/max width and offset for the tablet layout
- Removed bold style from action button

name: Support for APIs >= Froyo
body:
The minSDK version of the library has been lowered to 8.

Note that any apps running on APIs < 11 will not have the swipe-to-dismiss functionality. Enabling it explicitly won't have any effect.

name: Snackbar is always brought as parent's top view
body: See #27

name: Tablet support
body:
- Reintroduced tablet support, initially introduced with #7. When Inbox was released, the Snackbars used in there did not follow the specs from the guidelines for tablets, so the initial implementation was dropped
- Single-line snackbars are now 48dp tall as specified in the guidelines. The padding was left a bit different, however: 14dp at the top and 14dp at the bottom vs 16dp/12dp in the specs

name: Support for setColor(@resId) methods
body: See #21

name: Support for setText(@resId) methods
body: See #19

name: Listener for ListViews and RecyclerViews. Don't dismiss while swiping
body:
You can attach the Snackbar to a AbsListView (ListView, GridView) or a RecyclerView.
``` java Snackbar.with(getApplicationContext()) // context .type(Snackbar.SnackbarType.MULTI_LINE) // Set is as a multi-line snackbar .text("This is a multi-line snackbar. Keep in mind that snackbars are " + "meant for VERY short messages") // text to be displayed .duration(Snackbar.SnackbarDuration.LENGTH_LONG) .animation(false) // don't animate it .attachToAbsListView(listView) // Attach to ListView - attachToRecyclerView() is for RecyclerViews .show(this); // where it is displayed ``` A Snackbar won't be dismissed while it is being swiped

name: Unique resource IDs
body: To avoid ID conflicts with resources from other projects and or libs, all resources IDs now have a prefix as suggested in the developer docs

name: Event listener & Swipe-to-Dismiss enabling/disabling
body: The previous DismissListener has been changed to EventListener. This listener now notifies whenever the Snackbar is about to enter the screen and when it dismisses. The Snackbar used on Google's Inbox app is not swipeable, but since the Material Design Guidelines says that a Snackbar can be swiped, this functionality may now be disabled with swipeToDismiss(false). See the README file for the updated documentation.

name: Support for tablets/desktops
body: Support for tablets/desktops. See #7
